controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program provide for verification of KYC information about individuals using reliable and independent documentation?
Does your AML/CTF program require that documents used to verify KYC information have not expired (except for Commonwealth passports expired within the preceding two years)?
controls.detail-label: Describe your document expiration checking procedures

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include risk-based systems and controls to determine which reliable and independent documents are required to verify individual customer KYC information?
controls.detail-label: Describe your risk-based document selection framework for individuals

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program establish risk-based policies on when you will accept copies of reliable and independent documents?
controls.detail-label: Describe the circumstances where you accept document copies and relevant controls

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include risk-based systems to determine when you will check whether individual documents may have been forged, tampered with, cancelled or stolen?
controls.detail-label: Describe your fraud detection procedures and the steps you take to verify document authenticity

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program determine whether you will use any available authentication services for verifying individual documents?
controls.detail-label: Describe any authentication services you use or why they are not used

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program determine how and whether you will independently contact individuals to confirm KYC information?
controls.detail-label: Describe your independent confirmation procedures and the circumstances triggering their use

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program provide for verification of KYC information about customers who are not individuals using reliable and independent documentation?
Does your AML/CTF program include risk-based systems and controls to determine what reliable and independent documents you will use to verify non-individual customer information?
controls.detail-label: Describe your risk-based document selection framework for non-individual customers

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program establish risk-based policies on when you will accept copies of reliable and independent documents for non-individual customers?
controls.detail-label: Describe the circumstances where you accept document copies for non-individuals and relevant controls

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include risk-based systems to determine when you will check whether non-individual documents may have been forged, tampered with, cancelled or stolen?
controls.detail-label: Describe your fraud detection procedures for non-individual documents and the verification steps you take

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program determine whether you will use any available authentication services for verifying non-individual documents?
controls.detail-label: Describe any authentication services you use for non-individuals or why they are not used

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program determine how and whether you will independently contact non-individual customers to confirm their information?
controls.detail-label: Describe your independent confirmation procedures for non-individuals and the circumstances triggering their use

groups.title: Document Verification Framework
groups.description: Establish whether your AML/CTF program uses reliable and independent documentation to verify KYC information.

groups.title: Document Expiration & Validity
groups.description: Ensure documents used for verification have not expired and are still valid for use.

groups.title: Document Standards for Individuals
groups.description: Define risk-based requirements for which documents you will accept to verify information about individual customers, including name, date of birth, and residential address.

groups.title: Document Authentication for Individuals
groups.description: Establish procedures to detect and verify authenticity of individual documents, including fraud checks and authentication services.

groups.title: Independent Confirmation for Individuals
groups.description: Define when and how you will independently contact individuals to confirm their KYC information.

groups.title: Document Verification for Non-Individuals
groups.description: Establish whether your AML/CTF program uses reliable and independent documentation to verify KYC information about customers that are not individuals.

groups.title: Document Standards for Non-Individuals
groups.description: Define risk-based requirements for which documents you will accept to verify information about non-individual customers, including document contemporaneity and copy acceptance policies.

groups.title: Document Authentication for Non-Individuals
groups.description: Establish procedures to detect and verify authenticity of documents relating to non-individual customers, including fraud checks and authentication services.

groups.title: Independent Confirmation for Non-Individuals
groups.description: Define when and how you will independently contact non-individual customers to confirm their information.
